<div class="hero-section"> <div class="hero-inner"> <div class="hero-kicker">P8105 Final Project 路 Columbia Public Health</div> <div class="hero-title">High-Cost Patients in U.S. Healthcare: Evidence from MEPS 2023</div> <div class="hero-subtitle"> Using the 2023 Medical Expenditure Panel Survey (MEPS), we replicate and extend Mitchell (2023) to study how healthcare spending is concentrated, who the high-cost patients are, which conditions drive spending, and how costs are distributed across services and payers. </div> <div class="hero-buttons"> <a href="project.html" class="hero-btn-primary"> <i class="fa-solid fa-chart-line"></i> Explore code & results </a> <a href="proposal.html" class="hero-btn-ghost"> <i class="fa-regular fa-file-lines"></i> Read project proposal </a> </div> </div> </div>

<div class="stats-strip"><div class="stats-top-row"><div class="stats-card"><div class="stats-card-label"><i class="fa-solid fa-bullseye"></i> FOCUS</div><div class="stats-card-text">High-cost patients, healthcare utilization, and value-based care in the U.S. system.</div></div><div class="stats-card"><div class="stats-card-label"><i class="fa-solid fa-database"></i> DATA</div><div class="stats-card-text">2023 MEPS (HC-251 &amp; HC-249) with person-level costs, conditions, and survey design features.</div></div><div class="stats-card"><div class="stats-card-label"><i class="fa-solid fa-gears"></i> METHODS</div><div class="stats-card-text">Reproducible R workflows, regression modeling, and interactive reporting for technical and non-technical stakeholders.</div></div></div><div class="stats-bottom-row"><div class="stats-pill"><div class="stats-pill-label">Sample size</div><div class="stats-pill-value">&asymp; 18,900 individuals</div></div><div class="stats-pill"><div class="stats-pill-label">Study year</div><div class="stats-pill-value">MEPS 2023</div></div><div class="stats-pill"><div class="stats-pill-label">Cost segments</div><div class="stats-pill-value">Top 1% 路 5% 路 10%</div></div></div>

<div class="info-grid"> <div class="info-card"> <div class="info-card-title"> <i class="fa-solid fa-hospital-user info-card-icon"></i> High-cost patients </div> <div class="info-card-text"> We define expenditure groups (top 1%, 5%, 10%, bottom 50%) using survey-weighted percentiles of total annual expenditures (TOTEXP23). We then describe age, sex, race/ethnicity, income, and insurance across these groups. </div> </div> <div class="info-card"> <div class="info-card-title"> <i class="fa-solid fa-heart-pulse info-card-icon"></i> Conditions & disease burden </div> <div class="info-card-text"> Using the 2023 Medical Conditions file (HC-249) and CCSR categories, we identify the most commonly treated conditions and quantify their contribution to total spending among the top 5% of spenders. </div> </div> <div class="info-card"> <div class="info-card-title"> <i class="fa-solid fa-notes-medical info-card-icon"></i> Services, payers & dashboards </div> <div class="info-card-text"> We decompose expenditures by service type (inpatient, outpatient, ER, prescriptions, home health) and payer (out-of-pocket, private insurance, Medicare, Medicaid), and implement interactive visualizations using <code>rshiny</code> and <code>interactive dashboard</code>. </div> </div> </div>
